basics.name: Juan Santiago Urquiza
basics.label: Full Stack Web Developer | Intercultural Economic Management
basics.summary: With a background in intercultural economic management, the pandemic led me to immerse myself in the world of web programming, which I am deeply passionate about. In 2002, I began my training as a full-stack developer, and since then, I have been in constant learning, striving to combine business logic in programmable solutions. Currently, I mostly work with Javascript, React, Node.js, and MySQL.

work.name: Doctorando
work.summary: Part-time web development at Doctorando.com.ar. Applied technologies: HTML5, CSS3, Typescript, Angular, Ionic, Angular Material, Nodejs, MongoDB, Yarn 3. Workflow with Git, Gitlab, Agile.

work.name: Digital House
work.summary: Development of an responsive e-commerce web application using HTML for the structure, CSS for the design and JavaScript for client-side interactions. Setting up a web server in Node.js with Express as framework using the MVC design pattern. Integration with other platforms through APIs. Design the database with UML. Implement it with MySQL and Sequelize. Use Coockies and Session to store information. Implementing Javascript validations to forms. The whole project was managed using Git for distributed version control in a private repository for collaborative and organised work. Project carried out within the context of Digital House.

education.title: Full Stack Web Developer
education.summary: This unique combination of global business management, economics, communication, culture and languages makes the LiGEI a professional forged in an interdisciplinary career at an international level, practice-oriented with a global vision that responds to the needs of organizations that operate in different countries and demand highly qualified young people with the ability to achieve the best local and global results.

projects.name: Alquiler24
projects.description: Alquiler24 is a web application designed to address the challenges of rental management in an environment characterized by constant changes and high inflation, such as that of Argentina. This webapp enables users to track each contract with its specific details and update it according to price increases.

projects.name: Supermercado Alcer
projects.description: Website developed for Alcer supermarket in Argentina. In addition to providing users with the ability to make purchases, administrators have exclusive access to a dedicated view for managing the status of purchase orders. The checkout process is seamlessly integrated with the MercadoLibre API to facilitate payment management.

projects.name: Natalia Coaching
projects.description: Simple landing page created for a coaching professional

projects.name: CV Resume
